website_summaries.verdict: Small-screen, no-frills but functional drawing tablet for art, gaming, document signing, inking, and design.
pros: Slim and portable tablet useful for art as well as OSU!
gaming,  document signing, non-professional art work editing, inking, sculpting, etc
6" x 4" active space, with a battery-free pen featuring precise, 8192 level pressure sensitivity
High monitor resolution, fast refresh rate, and good for right- or left-handers
Can be used with most major design software
cons: Doesn't have all the features other models we considered have, but you may not need them

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Beginner Friendly
customer_reviews.text: Things to note - works well with minimal set up - uses the same driver as other tablets from this brand, allowing switching between tablets with ease - pen/stylus is not battery powered and does not need to be charged, also works with other models - comes with several spare nibs - lightweight - good tracking and pressure sensitivity - small if you prefer them smaller - no touch keys, if you're like me and don't really use the touch/hot keys it just gives you a place to grab without accidentally pressing one - cheap price - compatible with a variety of software - begginer friendly Photos include the box, everything included, and size comparison to their A30 model.
customer_reviews.author: SpaceNerd77

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for on the Go
customer_reviews.text: This light weight tablet is easy to use and would be a great drawing tablet for beginners! What I love about this product is the adaptor pieces it comes with. With these adaptors you don’t have to go out of your way if your device does not have a USB port. This tablet also connects to android phones! Though I don’t personally have an android phone, if I did, this tablet would change my life.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence B.

customer_reviews.title: Good for drawing... Wouldn't recommend for osu.
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this tablet a few months ago for christmas, it seems the configuration is very limited as it comes with intense shaking when you hover and barely move your pen. This problem has been addressed in the veikk osu tablet community but has yet to be solved even in the latest driver. To add, this tablet is really for osu! beginners as the configuration makes it very hard to improve. If you wanna draw and drag, this tablet is good but for hovering, especially if that's your preference, i wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: thirty-five

customer_reviews.title: The best savings I had made
customer_reviews.text: After adjusting the tablet's settings and the brush settings within each art program, it worked beautifully. I changed the shortcut buttons on the stylus to fit my preference. Keep in mind that you'll have to manually change brushes on programs or make sure the brush you use has the assigned "B" for the shortcut key and "E" for the eraser. I wouldn't recommend this tablet for travel purposes unless you have a protective (metal/padded) case because it's really thin. --- Programs I've tested it on: ClipStudio, SAI, Drawpile, Medibang, and Photoshop.
customer_reviews.author: Cinthia

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected! Took about 45 minutes to figure out the pen pressure, but I realized you need to uninstall any other tablet drivers first to get tit to work. As I naught this one to replace an old one, I'd forgotten. Great little pad; very happy with my purchase, and especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Damie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the Veikk tablets I've used so far, and this is my 3rd, this is by far the best BEGINNER tablet! It's cheap, but well made. Very small and very light well, overall perfect for someone who isnt sure how to begin, and wants to dip a toe into the digital art world. Works perfectly with Paint tool Sai, and makes very good strokes. My only bad thing is, how small it is, but that is because I have gotten accustomed to the large tablets, but the size is perfect for a starter.
customer_reviews.author: VixenQueenie

customer_reviews.title: Very good tablet at such a low cost!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this tablet! It comes with everything listed, and it works like a dream. I spent about a week testing and I've gotten used to it so quickly! After installing the driver, the pen pressure when opening my drawing program worked like a dream. This tablet would be amazing for beginners as well, who want to get themself a tablet for the first time! The tablet comes with everything listed, and I recommend it for all levels of artists, from beginner to expert!!! I totally hope you give this tablet a chance, it's super lightweight and is perfect for travelling.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Competes with other tablets
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a number of these tablets for my various computers and for friends and family. They work great, are lightweight and travel well. These are easy to use and my experience is they are as responsive as the Wacom tablets I've used at a much lower price. I've used them on MAC and PC machines with no problems and I've used them for everything from daily mousing to detailed work in Adobe Illustrator and photoshop, video editing programs and more. Solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: What a great drawing tablet! I've been using it for over a week and nothing but positive things to say about it! It's accurate and quite sleek for what it is. The pen is fairly durable and has two buttons that are quite clicky and responsive. The pen is comfortable to hold and it comes with a little pouch and replacement tips just in case something happens to the current one. The tablet is well worth it and I can see myself using it for a long time coming.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Kidd

customer_reviews.title: A little hard to set up, but great otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Really sturdy for how thin it is. -Has a very useful pen tip remover. -Allows for pen hovering. -Has programmable buttons on the pen. Cons: -Set up can take a while since you have to get rid of previous tablet drivers. -No buttons on the tablet itself. -Tablet itself is a little bit small, so large brush strokes aren't recommended. Overall: A very good starter tablet, or tablet for someone who only wants it for games like Osu!. Other than getting a little confused as to how to actually set it up, I didn't experience any issues with it. And it draws well, without latency or any weird skipping around the screen (like some tablets I've used before).
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely recommend this tablet to beginners! It’s 6x4 and super lightweight so it’s great in terms of portability. The pen pressure is absolutely wonderful being over 8000 levels. It also comes with extra nibs for the pen as well. I highly recommend this tablet towards beginner artists and osu players! It has a great price point and with it’s size and weight, you can take it anywhere! I included a drawing I'm working on which was drawn with this tablet!
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this pad/pen ALL the TIME! It has really increased his ability to create things on the computer. I was very impressed with it. He set it up entirely by himself (he is 13). I took away a star, Bc to have full functionality of the pen pressure sensitivity you have to upload hardware from the disc. You can’t just download it from the internet. That can be an issue since not all PCs have those drives anymore. Overall great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: A great tablet for any beginner or traveler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet for my son, and he loves it. I've had similar one in the price range, and this one has a much thinner profile. I issued 3 stars for ease if use because EVERY tablet has a leaning curve. Most people are alarmed with first use...because it's in absolute space not relative space like a mouse. A great tablet at a great price range. Stop drawing with a mouse!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Simple & Easy
customer_reviews.text: I'm only a amateur with recoloring and colorizing old photos, but this gives me some great results. I left a sample and I think you'll agree, it's pretty good for the first attempt.
customer_reviews.author: R Griffin

customer_reviews.title: I never used this item and returned it.
customer_reviews.text: The fact that my anti-virus/anti-malware program suggested that the Manufacturer's web site was, in it's opinion, unsafe due to multiple reasons. I have noticed that other users have ignored this and have no problems to report with this hardware or software. I am just not qualified to make an objective or complete review. I have reviewed what I am competent to review.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for digital art
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year for my 12-yr old daughter who loves to sketch. It took us both a little bit of googling to figure out some minor windows settings for this device to work well. Recently, my daughter took a digital art summer camp and the class was using Wacom tablet. My daughter told me that she is glad we didn't buy the Wacom one because it was much harder to use. For the price and the ease of setting up and use, it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Loann N.

customer_reviews.title: IT'S JUST GOOD MAN
customer_reviews.text: Listen to me. It's so good. It functions better than most Wacom tablets. Just get it, you won't be displeased, I promise. The pen is a tiny bit finicky but that's so minor compared to how good this thing is for the price. I use it to draw art and it is INSANE. The pressure levels are wonderful for digital painting and even then the pressure is manually adjustable, I recommend it to any art buff, beginner or advanced. Godspeed, my friends.
customer_reviews.author: MUFFINMAN

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice on a desk! Does it work? Not really.
customer_reviews.text: The driver for this device is hidden or it just exists on its own accord, doing as it pleases when it wants. Will it work when you want it to? Maybe! When you hold the pen in your hand will you muck up the job by putting your fingers over the two mysterious buttons? Probably! When you’ve got that person in your office & it’s time for them to digitally sign, will you awkwardly use your mouse. Yes. Because this doesn’t really work.
customer_reviews.author: jay joslin

customer_reviews.title: Get this Tablet!!
customer_reviews.text: After using this tablet for sometime I came to these conclusions Small sleek design allows tablet storage ease, as well as ease of access for cramped spaces. Easy to clean and maintenance is very simple. Pen response has little to no lag during long drawing sessions or OSU gaming sessions. Pen feels sturdy and contains enough weight to feel like drawing with a pencil Tablet and Pen gives a Pencil and Paper sound and feel this tablet is very good, very affordable and easy to use. I recommend anyone getting into digital art with a budget to get this tablet. Drivers are easy to install and the settings are very customizable to fit your drawing needs
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ensley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use! Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Osu Tablet to replace my mouse when i draw because of its uncomfortable positioning. This tablet is very comfortable ,slim and durable as it allows you to draw in a bunch of different positions. It is great for begginers. I also appreciate how you dont have to purchase batteries for the pen and how easy it is to remove the different pen tips. Overall if your a beginner looking to get into the digital art scene this is the tablet for you.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: No batteries! No problem!
customer_reviews.text: So this is wonderfully made. Honestly, the design is so slim and welcoming that it can literally fit in my work bag and purse. It's worked with Fire Alpaca, Krita, and Photoshop. The pen is BATTERYLESS. I say, BATTERYLESS! You don't have to worry about the battery dying nor having to constantly have batteries on stock for this tablet's pen. I've had this for a week now and I've had absolutely no problems from it. Thank you so much for the wonderful tablet, Veiikk!
customer_reviews.author: Sérénité

customer_reviews.title: Bad Drivers on Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: When this product worked, it was fine, but the drivers for Windows 10 are very spotty as the device continuously uninstalled itself and Windows 10 treated it like and unrecognized USB device. I became tired of installing over and over, plugging and unplugging the USB cable, etc.
customer_reviews.author: MGust

customer_reviews.title: Small, Portable, and No Problems!!
customer_reviews.text: Not only did this tablet only take about 2 minutes to setup, but you will immediately notice the stellar response speed and accuracy! I have two monitors, and it automatically found my main monitor and fit the surface area to my screen size. It works amazingly as both a mini drawing tablet, and an OSU tablet! I don't play OSU much, but I can confidently say that I feel much better using this tablet than my mouse. Super ridged construction, no bending and super well put together. If I had any criticism at all, it would be how the material is an absolute fingerprint factory, although as long as you keep it clean it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great starting or travel Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Veikk S640 pen tablet and I love it. I opened the box to find the tablet,pen and holder with extra tips. It is easy to use, I just plugged it in and opened my paint shop pro and started to use it. It is small so it is easy to manage on your lap, since I used it with my laptop. It is great for taking with you, for someone that is on the go that likes to draw outdoors.I would call it a great travel tablet. The price for the quality is great. It would also be great for a kid that is just getting started for drawing on the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great for newbies!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to digital art, I have zero experience with this stuff. I just played with it for an hour. At first I was a bit shaky cause I'm not an artist just a doodler in my spare time. After learning the pen sensitivity and how to use it with the assistance of my mouse it wasnt too bad. Idk all the short cuts yet but I'm sure over time I'll learn it properly!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Very good for osu! and drawing.
customer_reviews.text: It’s amazing especially for the price, This tablet is great for osu! if you are a drag or hover player it’s really good, The hover distance is great and dragging is so smooth. Also really responsive, And the drivers are so easy to use and edit, But the downsides for me are the pen and no detachable cord. The only reason I don’t like the pen is cause it is really slippery and doesn’t have rubbers grips but the pen is still really light and doesn’t have a battery. I really like this tablet, Definitely would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Osugaymer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, great for both drawing and osu!
customer_reviews.text: I instantly passed 3 osu! beatmaps right after buying this tablet and setting it up. I got it to work in GIMP, which is the only drawing software I use, and pen sensitivity was working just fine. However, after a reinstall of Windows (for various reasons), it was no longer detected in GIMP. Windows Ink still works with it fine and the Windows Ink workspace works with its variable pen sensitivity, but GIMP, the only drawing software I use, doesn't detect it, even after reinstalls of GIMP itself and various solutions online. It doesn't bother me much, but on a sidenote: can we get Linux drivers or release driver source code?
customer_reviews.author: Noorquacker

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to finally get this - I desperately needed it for remote work. I plugged it in, it glitched once on my laptop and then didn't work again. No phone number to call for customer service. Going with a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: could be great, just not for what I was plannign on
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this device would make it easier to create basic drawings or notes on screen shots, but the pen is hard to orientate with in refrence to another line and still has the wavy lines more so than the lines I draw with my trackball . so it works- just not for the application I was hoping to use it for. Super light weight, and the pen is easy to grasp ( it feels like a regular marker) love that it doesn't need batteries
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, portable beginner's tablet!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is very lightweight and portable, which makes it useful for on-the-go drawing! The driver is easy to install, but its text is rather small and a tad difficult to read. It's not a huge problem, though. Overall, this tablet is a great beginner's tablet for those who want to test the waters with digital art. It has all the bases covered: good pen pressure, portability, compatibility with a lot of common art programs, and programmable buttons. It's also great if you want a good, cheap portable tablet to bring around. It's great for the price. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mai

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: First things first. This tablet is extremely light and small, but it works to its advantage. Part of the advertising for it is that it's small and light, so it's easier to carry around. And boy does it deliver on its promise. Another thing that I liked, that could depend on your computer I don't know, is that I simply plugged it in and it worked immediately and I didn't have to install anything. Its smooth, the pen works flawlessly and I honestly can not recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Treyton Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Light!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is perfect for the go! I have a larger tablet that I try to take with me on trips, but it makes it very difficult. I can finally be able to draw while traveling without the bulkiness! I have been so used to my larger tablet, so it took a bit of time to adjust to the smaller size. I would definitely recommend! The tablet itself works well, is very light, and incredibly compact. It comes with essentially everything you need for drawing on the go!!
customer_reviews.author: Chirissu

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: A convenient tablet for any artist looking for both a portable and affordable tablet. The light weight and sleek design makes moving around with it very simple. It works well with any art softwares that I’ve used it with, (Sai, CSP, etc.) and holds up for it’s fair price. And yes, playing OSU with it felt very nice!!!
customer_reviews.author: Celadon

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Use this for tutoring on-line with my clients and it works great. Sensitivity of the pen is nice and handles well. Like the fact that you don't have to charge it. Size of the pad is nice. Oh, and it arrived in the two days since purchase. Speedy delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Hard to control
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea, however this is not easy to use at all. We tried for about a month. When you write it has to be exactly where it is on the page shown, but it is hard to get it there especially if it is the very top or bottom of the page or a corner. It is also hard to control.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie S Longpre

customer_reviews.title: Beats the heat
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Wacom tablet with my MacBook Pro and it caused it to run hot and drain the battery fairly fast. I decided to try this one to see if it would run cooler. My laptop runs very cool now and the battery lasts much longer. I never used the function buttons on the Wacom so I don't miss them. This tablet works very well for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Break drawing tablet for the size.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tablet for the size. My daughter is the artist feels that it's small but a great starter tablet and the pressure sensation is very good. It got her into digital drawing and animation. There's lots of good free programs out there to with it. Now we want a bigger one!
customer_reviews.author: Misty M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the artist on the go!
customer_reviews.text: This drawing tablet is perfect for the traveling artist. Super portable, nice and small so that it doesn't take up too much packing space. It's very responsive, super smooth, an extremely lightweight design (like, extremely). Only draw back I have on this? I feel like I'm going to break it on accident because of how insanely thin it is. But it's built very well, so I'm not too worried. It is also extremely affordable so if you are just starting out, give this a whirl and see what you think.
customer_reviews.author: Azreal

customer_reviews.title: Small, on-the-go, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is great for portable use and is very light and small. The lack of battery in the pen means you won't have to scout for AAAA batteries every year or so, and like the other tablets the company produces, the pen comes in its own pouch. About half the size of a sheet of paper, it's great to just sit in one hand and doodle on in the other, so on-the-go drawing has never been easier. For artists on-the-go or without much space, this smaller tablet is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tai

customer_reviews.title: A bit small in size but great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the product. I've used a Wacom Intuos for awhile but before hand I used a Wacom Bamboo. This tablet gives me that kind of nostalgia but more. It has amazing pen sensitivity, easy setup and pen feels so smooth on your hand. Although be warned, this tablet is small but it gets the job done. It's a great choice for beginner artists who want to start digital art.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi (Regrah)

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, quick customer service as well
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy it to draw but to play osu, and it's amazing for its price. The pen is great but is fragile, I dropped it at around waist height and stopped working. But when I contacted customer service, they were quick to reply and sent me a new pen.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Super fun, easy, simple drawing tablet. It is super simple to install, just plug it in and download like one thing it takes less than 2 minutes. It has definitely improved my art skills and probably will in the future too. I plan on using it a lot in the future while designing, drawing, or just messing around. Definitely a great buy if you want a slim simple device that is also very efficient and very small and portable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Billig

customer_reviews.title: Easy- Great first tab
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well and I have not had any issues. The pen doesn’t need to be charged which is awesome and you can keep working without the worry of it dying. The drawing feels very smooth and nice with extra tips incase you need them. The set up takes about 3 mins so you can draw right away!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for anyone!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet! I was nervous about how small it is, but I ended up loving the size. The smallness makes it light enough to place on top of my laptop without it pressing any of the keys! The pen glides so smoothly across the tablet. All in all, I highly recommend it to any artist, new or experienced!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Miller

customer_reviews.title: The Best Tablet for OSU! beginners
customer_reviews.text: Till now i had the tablet for 4-5 months and its working smoothly. Thats my opinion on it: Pros: -Lightwight -Slim Design -very responsive -Nice Pen Design and Texture -A Good Tablet for OSU! -No need to charge the pen -Extra Pen nips Cons: -Bad Software Overall, doesnt have any features , you can download a community driver but it should be improved anyway -Its good for entry level digital art
customer_reviews.author: XRedKiller

customer_reviews.title: Great starter tablet
customer_reviews.text: The VEIKK S640 Graphic Drawing Tablet is easy to use for both my daughter and I without much explanation at all. The pen is light and easy to use and has 2 buttons to be set up for use. Ctrl Z is very handy there! My daughter and I both love it and plan to use it for a good while. We only had 1 complication since we've gotten it and it was easily fixed. No complaints and a great starter tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love VEIKK!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is amazing. It’s become my new favorite thing to use. You can play little games on it, use photoshop, draw. It’s really good for people in graphic design or into anything artistic. All you have to do is hook it up to your computer and read the instructions and you’re good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Kourtney

customer_reviews.title: Works very well as described
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful everything works great and the tablet is compatible with my Photoshop. Although I was wary of downloading from an unsecured website. Everything has been good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bella Bynes

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some tablets, this one works by matching your pen up with your screen, so instead of needing to drag your cursor from the middle, it moves with the pen, which is my personal favorite feature. The pen also comes with a sleeve, making it difficult to lose. No issues with drawing, i was able to play browser games as well as my art programs with no problem. Its also small and portable. As a beginner with drawing tablets, this would be an awesome purchase.
customer_reviews.author: marlena jones

customer_reviews.title: Great starter tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful starter tablet! I made some amazing works with this tablet. The one empty star is simply because it doesn't have pressure points, which I would have loved because the tablet as a whole is an absolute beauty. The tablet came with several tips but with the long time I've had it, I've never had to change or replace the tip. And I'll tell ya that I'm a heavy-handed artist. The tablet is very sturdy and super thin so my hand could lay comfortably on both the table and tablet. Would I recommend? Of course!
customer_reviews.author: Fern R.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and thin but pressure sensitivity can be wacky
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is super lightweight/thin and the extra nibs are useful. However the pressure sensitivity can give u problems, if the sensitivity turns off randomly just unplug and replug. This is the only thing that really sucks about this tablet but it’s great for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: daph sain

customer_reviews.title: Great for online teaching
customer_reviews.text: I use this to write on my laptop screen while teaching. It works great, and I love that I don't have to charge the pen. Makes everything much easier than trying to use both a computer and an ipad.
customer_reviews.author: Music Student in College

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Not compatible with a chrome book so I had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: mcrose

customer_reviews.title: Use it for OSU
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but still 5 stars. Only complaint is that my hands get sweaty over time or long use and the pen starts to slip.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: More of a mouse Replacement than Pen Input
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking that this will give you a nice pen input you need to keep looking. This is more of a mouse replacement with the same resolution that your mouse has. It is crude at best.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Monforton

customer_reviews.title: great product in this price
customer_reviews.text: Worked in MS whiteboard as soon as I plugged in macbook pro running OS 10.13.6 . No additional software needed. Now I wish it was bit bigger in size and the pad had a protective case. May be too much to ask in this price.
customer_reviews.author: SBAN

customer_reviews.title: Small and portable!
customer_reviews.text: The S640 tablet from veikk is small but mighty, I absolutely love this guy for playing osu every now and then!, if you don’t have much room for a screen and need a small drawing tablet to test out what you like then this should be great! I mainly use it for osu, its light and the perfect size for playing the game! It’s a great size for portability and storing too!
customer_reviews.author: Ayanami

customer_reviews.title: 9/10 for Osu!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tablet with great drivers, tablet quality, good tracking, and a decent hovering distance <333 The only complaint I have would be lack of rubber grips. The pen can get really slippery for drag-players like me for maps that go over 2 min, although, I never really noticed my fingers slipping while hovering. Can't say much for art but, the resolution and pressure makes sketches look really well detailed. Best price/performance tablet you could buy ( My opinion <3)
customer_reviews.author: Kdfzy

customer_reviews.title: awesome tablet for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: there isn’t much to say about this tablet honestly! the size is small, but it's perfect that way. the installation process was very easy, as well. the tablet itself isn't difficult to work with and the pen has a very unique look! i've used many tablets before this one, but i was able to warm up to this one very quickly! it works right away and the sensitivity was excellent! picture on the right was drawn by me w/ this tablet! :3
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Jernigans

customer_reviews.title: Great for osu!
customer_reviews.text: After I bought this tablet I was instantly able to FC Big Black HD HR DT 100% Acc, but in all seriousness I think this is a great tablet for osu! players ( im not good at art :( so can't help you with that ). It's very cheap and is actually comparable to wacom. The only negative I have to say is that it doesn't have a detachable cable, even though that doesn't really affect me I know some people don't like that. 12/10 gg to ez :^)
customer_reviews.author: Jose Rosas

customer_reviews.title: did not last
customer_reviews.text: the stand in the back broke in about a week.
customer_reviews.author: D. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Best For beginner Digital Artist!
customer_reviews.text: The product is really slim. So it essentially could fit in any bag. Lightweight as well compared to my wacom this is a fresh change of weight. And Portable for those who want to be the on the kind of artist. For those wanting to try digital Art this is your best bet. I managed to do a quick sketch with the tablet. Do not let its small size fool you because it can be a little hard to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel
